author: rubys
msg: comment out virtual host example

author: costin
msg: Minor fixes:
- added optimize flag
- 80 col indentations :-)
- don't include j2ee adapter in webserver.jar, make it a separate jar ( previous
release of tomcat had it inside ) .
- FORM login for examples - it seems to work fine ( it is a feature that we should
support and is implemented )
- AccessInterceptor used to give bad warnings. We still detect pages starting with
cpath and work around, plus warn about it ( pet store will be fixed, but other may have
this problem )
- removed debug trace in mapper

author: costin
msg: Fix for the default interceptor.
SimpleMapper will now handle "/" mappings ( by setting a context note for the
default handler - the information is private to SimpleMapper ).
Fixed invoker to detect when a file has default mapping.
Removed few debug statements.

author: costin
msg: - stop treating /* in a non-standard way ( container ).
- minor fixes in JspServlet

author: costin
msg: JspInterceptor - experimental code, it will not be enabled by default.
It try to replace JspSerlvet/JspLoader, with an optimized critical path and
simplified operation and a lot of caching.
It works in a similar way with JspLoader:
- when a change is detected, a new class is generated (instead of a classical
reload ) - all classes have a version number
- after restart, we find what was the latest version and use it ( if no change,
we'll not recompile )
TODO:
- implement precompile
- implement destroy ( before compiling the new servlet, destroy previous one )
- name mangling - we use a simple scheme ( i.e. jsp dir -> package, jsp file name
+ version -> classname ). Probably we don't need to generate the same mangled
name, but we should add the code to avoid special cases like java keywords or invalid
names. IMHO the simple name is worth keeping when no special case is detected
Note that this version should corectly reload if a class used by a jsp is changed.
